level.heading: Uniformity of application and construction.
level.text: In applying and construing this uniform act, consideration shall be given to the need to promote uniformity of the law with respect to its subject matter among states that enact it.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 17-378 amended the section by redesignating this section.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 13-293
level.text: For D.C. Law 13-293, see notes following § 16-4501.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 17-378
level.text: Law 17-378, the "Uniform Child Abduction Act of 2008", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-626 which was referred to the Committee on Public Safety and the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 18, 2008, and December 2, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 29, 2009, it was assigned Act No. 17-716 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-378 became effective on March 25, 2009.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 401 of the Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (1997 Act).
